chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Julius Q. Kirby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.
*** Amended JOC - 102 days credit***

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.    Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside w/o Court's permission.  Not to reside w/ anyone of the opposite sex w/o court's permission.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 5yrs WSP consecutive to any previously imposed sentence; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 2yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for SAP or ERP.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  DNA ordered.  NOTE - after conclusion of sentencing hrg, court added an add'l condition of ES - to cooperate w/CSA.
from deft requesting sign. bond; denied by the Court.  Copy of letter sent to attys

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion; bond motion denied.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 9/24/15 @ 11am

108pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Terry Rose.  Clerk: NJurgens.  Referred to Br.3 for PTC on 8/13/15 @ 940am & Jury Selection set for 9/21/15 @ 9am.  Information filed.  Reading waived.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose. Clerk LE. KPD Det. Patrick Patton sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Rose. Probable cause not found as to Ct. 1, and Ct. 1 is dismissed. Probable cause found on Ct. 2. State requests adjournment for arraignment. Arraignment on 7-9-15 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.
